message_1:
Here's a numerical problem for a math student to solve:

The following table shows the monthly sales data of a store for the past 12 months. 

|Month | Sales (in $)|
|---|---|
| Jan | 1000 |
| Feb | 1500 |
| Mar | 1200 |
| Apr | 1800 |
| May | 2200 |
| Jun | 2000 |
| Jul | 2300 |
| Aug | 2500 |
| Sep | 2800 |
| Oct | 3000 |
| Nov | 3500 |
| Dec | 4000 |

Find the moving average for this data using a window of size 3. Determine the forecasted sales for the next month (13th month).
message_2:
To find the moving average using a window of size 3, we will calculate the average of every 3 consecutive months and then move one month forward until we reach the end of the data. 

1. (Jan + Feb + Mar) / 3 = (1000 + 1500 + 1200) / 3 = 3700 / 3 = 1233.33
2. (Feb + Mar + Apr) / 3 = (1500 + 1200 + 1800) / 3 = 4500 / 3 = 1500
3. (Mar + Apr + May) / 3 = (1200 + 1800 + 2200) / 3 = 5200 / 3 = 1733.33
4. (Apr + May + Jun) / 3 = (1800 + 2200 + 2000) / 3 = 6000 / 3 = 2000
5. (May + Jun + Jul) / 3 = (2200 + 2000 + 2300) / 3 = 6500 / 3 = 2166.67
6. (Jun + Jul + Aug) / 3 = (2000 + 2300 + 2500) / 3 = 6800 / 3 = 2266.67
7. (Jul + Aug + Sep) / 3 = (2300 + 2500 + 2800) / 3 = 7600 / 3 = 2533.33
8. (Aug + Sep + Oct) / 3 = (2500 + 2800 + 3000) / 3 = 8300 / 3 = 2766.67
9. (Sep + Oct + Nov) / 3 = (2800 + 3000 + 3500) / 3 = 9300 / 3 = 3100
10. (Oct + Nov + Dec) / 3 = (3000 + 3500 + 4000) / 3 = 10500 / 3 = 3500

Now, to forecast the sales for the next month (13th month), we can use the moving average of the last 3 months (Oct, Nov, and Dec). 

Forecasted sales for the 13th month = (3000 + 3500 + 4000) / 3 = 10500 / 3 = 3500

So, the forecasted sales for the next month (13th month) are $3,500.
